title: Sacroiliac stabilization for sacral metastasis: A case series
patient: A 53-year-old female with remote history of granulosa cell ovarian cancer presented with increasing sciatic/radicular pain and gluteal numbness. CT showed a very large expansile lytic lesion involving the entire right sacral ala, eroding through the right SI joint and dorsal cortex, with accompanying visceral and other bony metastases. Two months later, following biopsy confirmation of recurrent ovarian cancer and after failed nonoperative management [e.g., including and palliative radiation (30 gray)], she underwent surgery performed by a multidisciplinary team.
